greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(1) = 1; for n >= 2, a(n) = number of ways h to write the n-th perfect power A001597(n) as m^k with m >= 2 and k >= 1.
comment: Perfect powers with first occurrence of h >= 2: 4, 16, 64, 65536, 4096, ...
example: For n = 11: A001597(11) = 64; there are 4 ways to write 64 as m^k: 64^1 = 8^2 = 4^3 = 2^6.
results.author: _Jaroslav Krizek_, Jan 23 2010
